messages.content: I have worked in the NHS for 36 years, working hard to tackle health inequality. Since the Tories came to power nearly 10 years ago, my job has got harder. Cuts to the NHS have put huge pressure on resources, putting up waiting times in A&E, for a GP and cancer treatment.

Boris Johnson promised Â£350m a week more for the NHS, but you can't trust a word the man says. Under his watch infections have trebled, we have the worst waiting times since records began, and the cancer waiting list for operations has reached a record 4.4 million.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour's NHS Rescue Plan will restore the nursing bursary and recruit the thousands of doctors and nurses we need to end the Tory NHS crisis. Labour would also focus on prevention measures to stop people getting sick and tackle health inequalities and prioritise children's health and wellbeing.

issues.brexitEurope: Please think about the future of the NHS when you cast your vote on 12 December.
